page.title: 01Kippax Area
page.content: This block is predominantly a farming area containing several small farms which are mainly concentrating on cereals. There are also a couple of soft fruit growers and a pig farm. The land is boulder clay through which runs a band of magnesium limestone. In ancient times this band of hard rock, which runs north/south, acted as a natural roadway for early man. The villages in this area owe their original settlement to the proximity of this natural roadway. The main village is kippax which stands on an elevated situation and in the time of the Saxons there was a raised mount as well for the purpose of defence. This was called the keep near which stood a memorable Ash tree - hence the name Keep-Ash (Kippax).
